page.title: 01...THE GENERAL PICTURE.
page.content: This is a mainly residential area, developed since the second World War. Industrial development is mainly confined to the area North of the M6 motorway which bisects the 12 squares. There are many trees and open areas with some high rise development. The area is well served by local transport, and shops cater for most day to day needs. Levels of unemployment are high with the attendant social problems this brings. The county boundary of North Warwick- shire and Birmingham passes through the N.E. of the area and there has been recent property development for the private sector.
